009
010package imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters;
011
012import imagingbook.lib.filters.GenericFilter;
013import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ImageAccessor;
014import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ScalarAccessor;
015
016/**
017 * This class implements a Kuwahara-type filter, similar to the filter suggested in 
018 * Tomita and Tsuji (1977). It structures the filter region into five overlapping, 
019 * square subregions (including a center region) of size (r+1) x (r+1). 
020 * See algorithm 5.2 in Utics Vol. 3.
021 * 
022 * @author W. Burger
023 * @version 2013/05/30
024 */
025public class KuwaharaFilter extends GenericFilter {
026        
027        public static class Parameters {
028                /** Radius of the filter (should be even) */
029                public int radius = 2;
030                /** Threshold on sigma to avoid banding in flat regions */
031                public double tsigma = 5.0;     
032        }
033        
034        private Parameters params;
035        
036        private int n;                  // fixed subregion size 
037        private int dm;                 // = d-
038        private int dp;                 // = d+
039        
040        // these are used in calculation by several methods:
041        private float Smin;             // min. variance
042        private float Amin;             
043        private float AminR;
044        private float AminG;
045        private float AminB;
046
047        // constructor using default settings
048        public KuwaharaFilter() {
049                this.params = new Parameters();
050                initialize();
051        }
052        
053        public KuwaharaFilter(Parameters params) {
054                this.params = params;
055                initialize();
056        }
057        
058        public KuwaharaFilter(int r, double tsigma) {
059                this.params = new Parameters();
060                this.params.radius = r;
061                this.params.tsigma = tsigma;
062                initialize();
063        }
064        
065        void initialize() {
066                int r = params.radius;
067                n = (r + 1) * (r + 1);  // size of complete filter
068                dm = (r/2) - r;                 // d- = top/left center coordinate
069                dp = dm + r;                    // d+ = bottom/right center coordinate
070        }
071                
072        static int checkRadius(int radius) {
073                assert radius >= 1 : "filter radius must be >= 1";
074                return radius;
075        }
076        
077        // ------------------------------------------------------
078
079        /*
080         * This method is used for all scalar-values images.
081         */
082        @Override
083        public float filterScalar(ScalarAccessor ia, int u, int v) {
084                Smin = Float.MAX_VALUE;
085                evalSubregionGray(ia, u, v);                                    // a centered subregion (not in original Kuwahara)
086                Smin = Smin - (float)params.tsigma * n;                 // tS * n because we use variance scaled by n
087                evalSubregionGray(ia, u + dm, v + dm);
088                evalSubregionGray(ia, u + dm, v + dp);
089                evalSubregionGray(ia, u + dp, v + dm);
090                evalSubregionGray(ia, u + dp, v + dp);
091                return Amin;
092        } 
093        
094        /*
095         * sets the member variables Smin, Amin
096         */
097        void evalSubregionGray(ScalarAccessor ia, int u, int v) {
098                float S1 = 0; 
099                float S2 = 0;
100                for (int j = dm; j <= dp; j++) {
101                        for (int i = dm; i <= dp; i++) {
102                                float a = ia.getVal(u+i, v+j);
103                                S1 = S1 + a;
104                                S2 = S2 + a * a;
105                        }
106                }
107//              double s = (sum2 - sum1*sum1/nr)/nr;    // actual sigma^2
108                float s = S2 - S1*S1/n; // s = n * sigma^2
109                if (s < Smin) {
110                        Smin = s;
111                        Amin = S1 / n; // mean
112                }
113        }
114        
115        // ------------------------------------------------------
116        
117        final float[] rgb = {0,0,0};
118        
119        @Override
120        public float[] filterVector(ImageAccessor ia, int u, int v) {
121                Smin = Float.MAX_VALUE;
122                evalSubregion(ia, u, v);                                                // centered subregion - different to original Kuwahara!
123                Smin = Smin - (3 * (float)params.tsigma * n);   // tS * n because we use variance scaled by n
124                evalSubregion(ia, u+dm, v+dm);  
125                evalSubregion(ia, u+dm, v+dp);  
126                evalSubregion(ia, u+dp, v+dm);  
127                evalSubregion(ia, u+dp, v+dp);  
128                rgb[0] = (int) Math.rint(AminR);
129                rgb[1] = (int) Math.rint(AminG);
130                rgb[2] = (int) Math.rint(AminB);
131                return rgb;
132        }
133        
134        void evalSubregion(ImageAccessor ia, int u, int v) {
135                // evaluate the subregion centered at (u,v)
136                //final int[] cpix = {0,0,0};
137                int S1R = 0; int S2R = 0;
138                int S1G = 0; int S2G = 0;
139                int S1B = 0; int S2B = 0;
140                for (int j = dm; j <= dp; j++) {
141                        for (int i = dm; i <= dp; i++) {                
142                                final float[] cpix = ia.getPix(u + i, v + j);
143                                int red = (int) cpix[0];
144                                int grn = (int) cpix[1];
145                                int blu = (int) cpix[2];
146                                S1R = S1R + red;
147                                S1G = S1G + grn;
148                                S1B = S1B + blu;
149                                S2R = S2R + red * red;
150                                S2G = S2G + grn * grn;
151                                S2B = S2B + blu * blu;
152                        }
153                }
154                // calculate the variance for this subregion:
155                float nf = n;
156                float SR = S2R - S1R * S1R / nf;
157                float SG = S2G - S1G * S1G / nf;
158                float SB = S2B - S1B * S1B / nf;
159                // total variance (scaled by nr):
160                float Srgb = SR + SG + SB;
161                if (Srgb < Smin) { 
162                        Smin = Srgb;
163                        AminR = S1R / n;        
164                        AminG = S1G / n;
165                        AminB = S1B / n;
166                }
167        }
168}
